attributes.action: abandon plans to create a single central database of personal information.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The proposal to establish a single central database of personal information cuts right across the principle of privacy, a central value of British society. The track record of all governments with IT projects threatens that this will be costly and will not be secure. At lease we enjoy limited and default protection by virtue of the fact that personal information currently held is stored in several different sources.
